TEXT.P: Dose-response curves use a logarithmic scale along the X-axis. Logarithmic (or "log") scales are used when you are representing values that span a very large range--more precisely, when they span many "orders of magnitude."

A value is one order of magnitude greater than another value when it is roughly ten times greater. For example, $20 is an order of magnitude greater that $2. $2000 is two orders of magnitude greater than $20.
